newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bull says institutional share sale oversubscribed.
newsitem.headline: Bull says institutional share sale oversubscribed.

text.p: Cie des Machines Bull said on Wednesday its offering of shares to institutional investors had been "greatly oversubscribed."
"Institutional investors, most of them European, responded very positively to the offer of Bull shares, which was greatly oversubscribed," Bull said in a statement.
France had on Wednesday morning launched the sale to institutional investors of 14.58 million Bull shares at 38 francs per share.

Another 1.62 million shares were being offered to individual investors at a price of 36 francs a share. Bull did not say how that offer had been received, but it said the number to be offered to individuals could later be increased to as many as 3.1 million shares.
The sale of the shares would reduce France's stake in Bull to 17 percent from the current 30.5 percent.
Other Bull shareholders include France Telecom with 18.7 percent, NEC Corp of Japan and Motorola Inc .
